column4: My DVDplayer doesn't work properly.. (I use Totem) when I put in a DVD it will start playing directly without the menus and if I stop the player and press "Play Disc" to do it again it will just tell me that I'm lacking a component or a plugin or something..
I have tried Ogle, but that doesn't work at all..
see the howtos ubotu threw at you :-)
are they sitting on the couch and refuse to raise when you tell them to, or waht?

well.. the thing is that none of the players i've tried (totem, ogle, gxine) seems to able to play my dvds.. ogle just disappears, gxine cannot locate anything and totem tells me that it does not exist a plugin to handle my dvd.. the strange thing is that, when having totem installed, when i put in a dvd it will just start directly but without the menus and subtitles.. as soon as i press "play disc" to restart it, it just stops..
have you installed libdvdcss ? You know, the little thingy that handles the DeCSS stuff, which will allow you to watch DVDs in Linux,
yes I think so.. but it will play - as long as I do not tell it to do so..
try vlc ... totem sucks anyway IMHO
there's no picture and the sound is jumping..
is MDA enabled for your DVD-drive?
do i need anything other than a player and the libdvdread3?
and because this hacks the CSS protection it's not in official repos
okay.. where do i find it then..
read the !DVD factoid again (which was the first thing i gave you :-) )
yes.. it doesn't mention anything other than libdvdread3
